item.title: 欧佩克+"供应担忧和美国经济放缓迹象导致石油止跌回升
item.description: 由于交易商担心 "欧佩克+"可能会增加供应，美国数据显示经济放缓，以及行业估计显示一个关键储存中心的库存增加，石油在一个月来最大跌幅后企稳。【原文：Oil steadied after falling by the most in a month as traders fretted that OPEC+ may boost supplies, US data pointed to a slowdown, and an industry estimate showed higher stockpiles at a key storage hub.】

item.title: 纳斯达克修订小型 IPO 和中国企业上市规则
item.description: 纳斯达克公司（Nasdaq Inc. ）正在修改小型首次公开募股公司上市和继续在其交易所交易必须遵守的规则，这是纳斯达克为保护投资者免受市场剧烈波动影响和提高流动性所做的最新努力。【原文：Nasdaq Inc. is revamping rules that companies pursuing small initial public offerings must follow to list and continue to be traded on its exchanges, the latest effort to protect investors from wild swings in the market and improve liquidity.】

item.title: 澳大利亚央行行长称，澳大利亚消费强劲可能会减缓降息步伐
item.description: 澳大利亚储备银行行长米歇尔-布洛克（Michele Bullock）表示，随着可支配收入和财富的攀升，澳大利亚消费者开始增加支出，这对经济是一个可喜的推动，如果货币宽松政策持续下去，可能会放缓步伐。【原文：Australian consumers are starting to spend more as disposable incomes and wealth climb, a welcome boost for the economy that could slow the pace of monetary easing if it persists, according to Reserve Bank Governor Michele Bullock.】

item.title: 全球财政风险上升，日本面临艰难的 30 年期债券销售
item.description: 日本周四的 30 年期国债拍卖面临着全球债务市场动荡和国内政局不稳带来的更多不确定性，这再次引发了人们对日本财政前景的担忧。【原文：Japan’s 30-year government bond auction Thursday faces added uncertainty from global debt market turmoil and political instability at home which has reignited concerns over the country’s fiscal outlook.】

item.title: 蕾切尔-里夫斯的损害控制预算引发英国经济增长担忧
item.description: 英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）说，增长是解决英国经济问题的办法。在 11 月 26 日的预算中，她面临着不得不扼杀增长的前景。【原文：Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves says growth is the solution to Britain’s economic problems. At her budget on Nov. 26, she faces the prospect of having to kill it.】

item.title: 研究称，英国合伙企业税可为里夫斯带来 19 亿英镑收入
item.description: 英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）试图填补公共财政中的一个黑洞，她提出了一项建议，即取消对商业合伙关系的过时减免，从而每年从律师、会计师和金融家那里筹集 19 亿英镑（约合 26 亿美元）的资金。【原文：The UK could raise £1.9 billion ($2.6 billion) a year from lawyers, accountants and financiers by removing an outdated relief for business partnerships, according to a proposal that could help Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves as she seeks to fill a black hole in the public finances.】

item.title: 中国股市和人民币反弹激发良性反馈循环的希望
item.description: 中国股市的飙升激起了对人民币的看涨情绪，从而引发了一种良性循环的前景，即一种资产类别的收益增强了另一种资产类别的信心。【原文：A surge in Chinese equities is stoking bullish sentiment toward the yuan, raising prospects of a virtuous cycle where gains in one asset class reinforce confidence in the other.】

item.title: 新加坡滚雪球般增长的现金水平推动了当地债券的发展
item.description: 最近新加坡货币市场上现金的增加加强了对该国债券的需求，使其回报率接近该地区的最高水平。【原文：The recent build-up of cash in Singapore’s money market is strengthening demand for the nation’s bonds, driving returns to near the highest in the region.】

item.title: 桥水基金大举进军中国市场，吸引数十亿资金和大量候选者
item.description: 桥水联合公司（Bridgewater Associates）的对冲基金在中国如此受欢迎，以至于富裕的投资者向中国的大型私人银行投入数十亿美元，只为获得购买这些基金的权利。【原文：Bridgewater Associates’ hedge funds have become so popular in China that wealthy investors are pouring billions into the nation’s major private banks just for the right to buy them.】

item.title: 美国就业疲软加剧美联储押注，亚洲股市将上涨：市场综述
item.description: 周四，美国就业形势疲软，加强了对美联储降息的押注，从而提振了华尔街的股票和债券，亚洲股市随之上扬。【原文：Asian equities were primed to rise Thursday after weak US job openings reinforced bets on a Federal Reserve rate cut, boosting stocks and bonds on Wall Street.】

item.title: 特朗普称马斯克有 "问题"，但认为他将重返美国共和党
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统说，在今年早些时候他们之间出现高度公开的裂痕之后，前盟友埃隆-马斯克别无选择，只能重返共和党。【原文：President Donald Trump said former ally Elon Musk has no choice but to return to the Republican Party after their highly public rift earlier this year.】

item.title: 阿根廷政府指责中国银行推动比索下跌
item.description: 阿根廷总统哈维尔-米莱（Javier Milei）政府的一位高级官员称，一家中国银行周一利用当天外汇市场流动性稀缺的机会，故意压低比索币值。【原文：A top official in Argentine President Javier Milei’s government said a Chinese bank deliberately pushed down the peso’s value on Monday, taking advantage of thin liquidity in the foreign-exchange market that day.】

item.title: 美国、英国和日本的长期债券收益率为何上升
item.description:
今日要闻：随着一些投资者对政府的财政纪律失去信心，对长期债券的需求正在减弱。【原文：

Today on the Big Take: As some investors lose confidence in government fiscal discipline, demand is softening for long-dated bonds.

】

item.title: Biva 首席执行官称，墨西哥将快速实施对冲基金新规
item.description: 墨西哥第二大证券交易所负责人表示，该国最近任命的两名高级金融官员应加快对对冲基金的监管，从而有望促进该国资本市场的投资。墨西哥第二大证券交易所负责人表示，该国最近任命了两名高级金融官员，这将加快对对冲基金的监管，有望促进该国资本市场的投资。【原文：The head of Mexico’s no. 2 stock exchange said the recent appointment of two top financial officials in the country should speed up regulations for hedge funds that are expected to boost investment in its capital markets.】

item.title: 马来西亚将维持利率不变，决策者正在评估宽松政策的影响
item.description: 马来西亚央行可能会在周四维持利率不变，因为决策者正在评估美国关税和近期降息对该国经济的影响。【原文：Malaysia’s central bank will likely keep interest rates unchanged on Thursday as policymakers assess the impact of US tariffs and a recent rate cut on the nation’s economy.】

item.title: 谷歌因人工智能威胁免于反垄断案解体
item.description: Alphabet Inc. 旗下的谷歌公司去年被美国认定垄断了在线搜索市场，但却避免了最严重的结果，因为该案的法官认为，谷歌的业务已经受到来自人工智能的日益严重的威胁。【原文：Alphabet Inc.’s Google, found by the US last year to have a monopoly in online search, avoided the most severe outcomes because the judge in the case concluded that its business was already under a growing threat — from AI.】

item.title: 交易员为关键就业数据做好准备，看跌国债的押注增加
item.description: 看跌美国国债的押注正在激增，周五就业报告的利害关系也随之加大，该报告可能会巩固人们对美联储将在 9 月份会议上以何种力度降息的看法。【原文：Bearish bets are proliferating in US Treasuries and raising the stakes around Friday’s employment report, which may cement views on how aggressively the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates at its September meeting.】

item.title: 保时捷公司将在不到三年后退出德国 DAX 指数
item.description: 从大众汽车公司分拆出来的豪华汽车制造商保时捷公司（Porsche AG）在不到三年的时间里就退出了德国基准股票指数。【原文：Porsche AG, the luxury carmaker spun off from Volkswagen AG, is dropping out of Germany’s benchmark stock index after less than three years.】

item.title: XAI 首席财务官上任三个月后离开埃隆-马斯克的人工智能企业
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，XAI 首席财务官迈克-利伯拉托尔（Mike Liberatore）在上任几个月后就离开了公司，埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的人工智能初创公司出现了一个备受瞩目的空缺。【原文：XAI Chief Financial Officer Mike Liberatore has left the company just a few months after taking the job, according to people familiar with the matter, creating a high-profile vacancy at Elon Musk’s artificial intelligence startup.】

item.title: HPE 公布不温不火的利润预测，再次引发对利润率的担忧
item.description: 惠普企业公司（Hewlett Packard Enterprise Co.【原文：Hewlett Packard Enterprise Co. gave a disappointing earnings forecast for the current period, renewing concerns about tightening margins in the server computer industry.】

item.title: Salesforce 预计销售额增长乏力，人工智能焦虑加剧
item.description: Salesforce Inc. 预计季度销售额增长乏力，加剧了华尔街对这家软件巨头在新兴人工智能公司的竞争中败下阵来的担忧。【原文：Salesforce Inc. projected lackluster quarterly sales growth, fueling Wall Street’s fears that the software giant is losing out to competition from emerging artificial intelligence companies.】

item.title: 贝莱德的 Akaysha 公司获得 3 亿澳元资金发展电池车队
item.description: 贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc.【原文：BlackRock Inc.-owned Australia battery maker Akaysha Energy Pty. has raised A$300 million ($196 million) in debt to expand its global battery fleet, according to a company statement.】

item.title: 在美国的不确定性中，股市为何屡创新高？
item.description:
在本期特朗普经济学节目中，我们将探讨市场上的一个奇特现象：大多数投资者认为股票估值过高，但又不想卖出。【原文：

On this episode of Trumponomics, we explore the curious moment in markets where most investors see equities as overvalued but don’t want to sell just yet. 

】

item.title: 苹果计划为 Siri 提供人工智能网络搜索工具，与 OpenAI 和 Perplexity 竞争
item.description: 苹果公司计划明年推出自己的人工智能网络搜索工具，加强与 OpenAI 和 Perplexity AI 公司的竞争。【原文：Apple Inc. is planning to launch its own artificial intelligence-powered web search tool next year, stepping up competition with OpenAI and Perplexity AI Inc.】

item.title: 激进分子普朗特罗推动信息服务公司董事会大换血
item.description: 加拿大数据库公司信息服务公司（Information Services Corp.【原文：Canadian database company Information Services Corp. is facing a fresh challenge from one of its top shareholders, which is pressing for major changes to the board after increasing its stake.】

item.title: Mistral 新一轮融资估值将达 140 亿美元
item.description: 法国人工智能初创公司 Mistral AI 正在敲定一笔 20 亿欧元的投资，包括新融资在内，该公司的估值达 120 亿欧元（约合 140 亿美元）— 巩固了其作为欧洲最有价值的科技初创公司之一的地位。【原文：French artificial intelligence startup Mistral AI is finalizing a €2 billion investment that values the company at €12 billion ($14 billion), including the new funding — solidifying its position as one of Europe’s most valuable tech startups.】

item.title: 美国在加勒比地区展示武力后委内瑞拉债券上涨
item.description: 委内瑞拉债券连续第二天反弹，达到六年多来的最高水平，原因是美国对加勒比海地区涉嫌贩毒者的打击增加了对尼古拉斯-马杜罗总统政府的压力。【原文：Venezuelan bonds are rallying for a second day, reaching their highest levels in more than six years, as a US strike against alleged drug traffickers in the Caribbean adds to pressure on the administration of President Nicolas Maduro.】

item.title: 中国对美国进口光纤征收反倾销关税
item.description: 在为期六个月的调查发现美国公司规避中国的反倾销措施后，中国开始对额外的美国进口光纤征税。【原文：China started imposing levies on additional US optical fiber imports after a six-month investigation found that American companies circumvented the country’s anti-dumping measures.】

item.title: 玻利维亚候选人誓言洗刷智利走私汽车的 "罪恶
item.description: 玻利维亚农村地区充斥着从邻国智利走私入境的二手车。该国的头号总统候选人希望让这些汽车全部合法化。【原文：Rural Bolivia is awash in used cars smuggled in from neighboring Chile. The country’s top presidential candidate wants to make them all legal.】

item.title: 沙特与英国深化关系，联合投资 3.6 亿英镑
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯和英国宣布了超过 3.6 亿英镑（4.84 亿美元）的联合投资交易，两国希望进一步加强经济联系，促进跨境投资。【原文：Saudi Arabia and the UK announced more than £360 million ($484 million) in joint investment deals as the countries look to further boost economic ties and promote cross-border investment.】
